articles.headline: Tariff Threats Show Trump’s Commitment to Upending Global Trade
articles.snippet: The president-elect’s threat to hit Canada, Mexico and China with new tariffs is already rocking business and diplomatic relationships and could topple the trade pacts he signed in his first term.
articles.abstract: The president-elect’s threat to hit Canada, Mexico and China with new tariffs is already rocking business and diplomatic relationships and could topple the trade pacts he signed in his first term.
articles.lead_paragraph: President-elect Donald J. Trump’s threats to impose damaging tariffs on Canada, Mexico and China may ultimately be an opening wager to try to use the power of the American market to persuade other countries to stem a flow of drugs and migrants across U.S. borders.

articles.headline: Israel Approves Cease-Fire With Hezbollah to Halt War in Lebanon
articles.snippet: President Biden said the 60-day truce, which the United States helped broker, would take effect early Wednesday, and was intended to become permanent, ending Lebanon’s deadliest war in decades.
articles.abstract: President Biden said the 60-day truce, which the United States helped broker, would take effect early Wednesday, and was intended to become permanent, ending Lebanon’s deadliest war in decades.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Israeli security cabinet on Tuesday night approved a deal for a cease-fire with Hezbollah in Lebanon, signaling that more than a year of conflict will soon be suspended, and raising hopes around the region that Lebanon’s deadliest war in decades could be over.
articles.byline: By Aaron Boxerman, Adam Rasgon, Euan Ward and Michael Levenson

articles.headline: Trump Taps Kevin Hassett to Lead National Economic Council
articles.snippet: Mr. Hassett defended Donald Trump’s tax cuts and trade policies in his first administration but has also acknowledged that tariffs can weaken economic growth.
articles.abstract: Mr. Hassett defended Donald Trump’s tax cuts and trade policies in his first administration but has also acknowledged that tariffs can weaken economic growth.
articles.lead_paragraph: Follow the latest updates on President-elect Trump’s transition.
articles.byline: By Jonathan Swan, Maggie Haberman, Alan Rappeport and Ana Swanson

articles.headline: America’s Great Unifying Event: The Macy’s Thanksgiving Day Parade
articles.snippet: The nostalgia-fueled production has been the most-watched entertainment program in the United States for the past three years, ahead of the Oscars and the World Series.
articles.abstract: The nostalgia-fueled production has been the most-watched entertainment program in the United States for the past three years, ahead of the Oscars and the World Series.
articles.lead_paragraph: It might be the kookiest three and a half hours in all of television.

articles.headline: Chinese Automakers Tell Suppliers to Cut Costs as Price War Deepens
articles.snippet: China’s electric vehicle market is the world’s largest — and its most cutthroat, with dozens of brands jostling for position.
articles.abstract: China’s electric vehicle market is the world’s largest — and its most cutthroat, with dozens of brands jostling for position.
articles.lead_paragraph: Faced with a bruising price war in the fast growing but crowded domestic market for electric vehicles, Chinese automobile manufacturers are pressuring suppliers to deliver hefty cost cuts.
articles.byline: By Claire Fu and Daisuke Wakabayashi

articles.headline: Will Lebanon Deal Break Gaza Deadlock? Experts Doubt It
articles.snippet: Hamas is unlikely to compromise in Gaza, despite the decision by its ally, Hezbollah, to stop fighting. A deal in Gaza would also be harder for Benjamin Netanyahu, the Israeli prime minister.
articles.abstract: Hamas is unlikely to compromise in Gaza, despite the decision by its ally, Hezbollah, to stop fighting. A deal in Gaza would also be harder for Benjamin Netanyahu, the Israeli prime minister.
articles.lead_paragraph: Buoyant after helping to forge a cease-fire in Lebanon, President Biden has declared that the deal could build momentum toward a similar breakthrough in Gaza.

articles.headline: 3 Americans, Including F.B.I. Informant, Are Freed in Prisoner Swap With China
articles.snippet: The Americans released, among others, a Chinese intelligence officer who was serving a 20-year sentence in the United States.
articles.abstract: The Americans released, among others, a Chinese intelligence officer who was serving a 20-year sentence in the United States.
articles.lead_paragraph: Three Americans who were detained in China have been released in a prisoner swap with Beijing, the Biden administration said on Wednesday. One of the men had been an F.B.I. informant, according to senior U.S. officials.
articles.byline: By Adam Goldman, Mara Hvistendahl, Edward Wong and Zolan Kanno-Youngs
